trans-unit.source: Move and process log files using Azure Data Factory (Azure Portal)
trans-unit.target: Move and process log files using Azure Data Factory (Azure Portal)

trans-unit.source: This advanced tutorial describes a near real-world scenario and implements the scenario using Azure Data Factory service and Data Factory Editor in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: This advanced tutorial describes a near real-world scenario and implements the scenario using Azure Data Factory service and Data Factory Editor in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Measuring effectiveness of a marketing campaign
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Measuring effectiveness of a marketing campaign

trans-unit.source: Contoso is a gaming company that creates games for multiple platforms: game consoles, hand held devices, and personal computers (PCs).
trans-unit.target: Contoso is a gaming company that creates games for multiple platforms: game consoles, hand held devices, and personal computers (PCs).

trans-unit.source: These games produce a lot of logs and Contoso’s goal is to collect and analyze these logs to gain insights into customer preferences, demographics, usage behavior etc. to identify up-sell and cross-sell opportunities, develop new compelling features to drive business growth and provide a better experience to customers.
trans-unit.target: These games produce a lot of logs and Contoso’s goal is to collect and analyze these logs to gain insights into customer preferences, demographics, usage behavior etc. to identify up-sell and cross-sell opportunities, develop new compelling features to drive business growth and provide a better experience to customers.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create Data Factory pipelines to evaluate the effectiveness of a marketing campaign that Contoso has recently launched by collecting sample logs, processing and enriching them with reference data, and transforming the data.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create Data Factory pipelines to evaluate the effectiveness of a marketing campaign that Contoso has recently launched by collecting sample logs, processing and enriching them with reference data, and transforming the data.

trans-unit.source: It has the following three pipelines:
trans-unit.target: It has the following three pipelines:

trans-unit.source: The **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** reads the raw game events from blob storage and creates partitions based on year, month, and day.
trans-unit.target: The **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** reads the raw game events from blob storage and creates partitions based on year, month, and day.

trans-unit.source: The **EnrichGameLogsPipeline** joins partitioned game events with geo code reference data and enriches the data by mapping IP addresses to the corresponding geo-locations.
trans-unit.target: The **EnrichGameLogsPipeline** joins partitioned game events with geo code reference data and enriches the data by mapping IP addresses to the corresponding geo-locations.

trans-unit.source: The **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline** pipeline leverages the enriched data and processes it with the advertising data to create the final output that contains marketing campaign effectiveness.
trans-unit.target: The **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline** pipeline leverages the enriched data and processes it with the advertising data to create the final output that contains marketing campaign effectiveness.

trans-unit.source: Getting ready for the tutorial
trans-unit.target: Getting ready for the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Read [Introduction to Azure Data Factory][adfintroduction] to get an overview of Azure Data Factory and understanding of the top level concepts.
trans-unit.target: Read [Introduction to Azure Data Factory][adfintroduction] to get an overview of Azure Data Factory and understanding of the top level concepts.

trans-unit.source: You must have an Azure subscription to perform this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You must have an Azure subscription to perform this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: For information about obtaining a subscription, see [Purchase Options](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/), [Member Offers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/), or [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: For information about obtaining a subscription, see [Purchase Options](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/), [Member Offers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/), or [Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: You must download and install [Azure PowerShell][download-azure-powershell] on your computer.
trans-unit.target: You must download and install [Azure PowerShell][download-azure-powershell] on your computer.

trans-unit.source: You will execute Data Factory cmdlets to upload sample data and pig/hive scripts to your blob storage.
trans-unit.target: You will execute Data Factory cmdlets to upload sample data and pig/hive scripts to your blob storage.

trans-unit.source: **(recommended)** Review and practice the tutorial in the [Get started with Azure Data Factory][adfgetstarted] article for a simple tutorial to get familiar with the portal and cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: **(recommended)** Review and practice the tutorial in the [Get started with Azure Data Factory][adfgetstarted] article for a simple tutorial to get familiar with the portal and cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: **(recommended)** Review and practice the walkthrough in the [Use Pig and Hive with Azure Data Factory][usepigandhive] article for a walkthrough on creating a pipeline to move data from on-premises data source to an Azure blob store.
trans-unit.target: **(recommended)** Review and practice the walkthrough in the [Use Pig and Hive with Azure Data Factory][usepigandhive] article for a walkthrough on creating a pipeline to move data from on-premises data source to an Azure blob store.

trans-unit.source: Download [ADFWalkthrough][adfwalkthrough-download] files to **C:\ADFWalkthrough** folder **preserving the folder structure**:
trans-unit.target: Download [ADFWalkthrough][adfwalkthrough-download] files to **C:\ADFWalkthrough** folder **preserving the folder structure**:

trans-unit.source: **Pipelines:** It includes JSON files containing the definition of the pipelines.
trans-unit.target: **Pipelines:** It includes JSON files containing the definition of the pipelines.

trans-unit.source: **Tables:** It includes JSON files containing the definition of the Tables.
trans-unit.target: **Tables:** It includes JSON files containing the definition of the Tables.

trans-unit.source: **LinkedServices:** It includes JSON files containing the definition of your storage and compute (HDInsight) cluster
trans-unit.target: **LinkedServices:** It includes JSON files containing the definition of your storage and compute (HDInsight) cluster

trans-unit.source: **Scripts:** It includes Hive and Pig scripts that are used for processing the data and invoked from the pipelines
trans-unit.target: **Scripts:** It includes Hive and Pig scripts that are used for processing the data and invoked from the pipelines

trans-unit.source: **SampleData:** It includes sample data for this walkthrough
trans-unit.target: **SampleData:** It includes sample data for this walkthrough

trans-unit.source: **OnPremises:** It includes JSON files and script that are used for demonstrating accessing your on-premises data
trans-unit.target: **OnPremises:** It includes JSON files and script that are used for demonstrating accessing your on-premises data

trans-unit.source: **uploadSampleDataAndScripts.ps1:** This script uploads the sample data & scripts to Azure.
trans-unit.target: **uploadSampleDataAndScripts.ps1:** This script uploads the sample data & scripts to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have created the following Azure Resources:
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have created the following Azure Resources:

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight Cluster of version 3.1 or above (or use an on-demand HDInsight cluster that the Data Factory service will create automatically)
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight Cluster of version 3.1 or above (or use an on-demand HDInsight cluster that the Data Factory service will create automatically)

trans-unit.source: Once the Azure Resources are created, make sure you have the information needed to connect to each of these resources.
trans-unit.target: Once the Azure Resources are created, make sure you have the information needed to connect to each of these resources.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage Account** - Account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage Account** - Account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: **Azure SQL Database** - Server, database, user name, and password.
trans-unit.target: **Azure SQL Database** - Server, database, user name, and password.

trans-unit.source: **Azure HDInsight Cluster**.
trans-unit.target: **Azure HDInsight Cluster**.

trans-unit.source: - Name of the HDInsight cluster, user name, password, and account name and account key for the Azure storage associated with this cluster.
trans-unit.target: - Name of the HDInsight cluster, user name, password, and account name and account key for the Azure storage associated with this cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use an on-demand HDInsight cluster instead of your own HDInsight cluster you can skip this step.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use an on-demand HDInsight cluster instead of your own HDInsight cluster you can skip this step.

trans-unit.source: Launch **Azure PowerShell** and execute the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Launch **Azure PowerShell** and execute the following commands.

trans-unit.source: Keep the Azure PowerShell open.
trans-unit.target: Keep the Azure PowerShell open.

trans-unit.source: If you close and reopen, you need to run these commands again.
trans-unit.target: If you close and reopen, you need to run these commands again.

trans-unit.source: Run **Add-AzureAccount** and enter the user name and password that you use to sign-in to the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: Run **Add-AzureAccount** and enter the user name and password that you use to sign-in to the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: Run **Get-AzureSubscription** to view all the subscriptions for this account.
trans-unit.target: Run **Get-AzureSubscription** to view all the subscriptions for this account.

trans-unit.source: Run **Select-AzureSubscription** to select the subscription that you want to work with.
trans-unit.target: Run **Select-AzureSubscription** to select the subscription that you want to work with.

trans-unit.source: This subscription should be the same as the one you used in the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: This subscription should be the same as the one you used in the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The end-to-end workflow is depicted below:
trans-unit.target: The end-to-end workflow is depicted below:

trans-unit.source: Tutorial End to End Flow
trans-unit.target: Tutorial End to End Flow

trans-unit.source: The **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** reads the raw game events from a blob storage (RawGameEventsTable) and creates partitions based on year, month, and day (PartitionedGameEventsTable).
trans-unit.target: The **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** reads the raw game events from a blob storage (RawGameEventsTable) and creates partitions based on year, month, and day (PartitionedGameEventsTable).

trans-unit.source: The **EnrichGameLogsPipeline** joins partitioned game events (PartitionedGameEvents table, which is an output of the PartitionGameLogsPipeline) with geo code (RefGetoCodeDictionaryTable) and enriches the data by mapping an IP address to the corresponding geo-location (EnrichedGameEventsTable).
trans-unit.target: The **EnrichGameLogsPipeline** joins partitioned game events (PartitionedGameEvents table, which is an output of the PartitionGameLogsPipeline) with geo code (RefGetoCodeDictionaryTable) and enriches the data by mapping an IP address to the corresponding geo-location (EnrichedGameEventsTable).

trans-unit.source: The **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline** pipeline leverages the enriched data (EnrichedGameEventTable produced by the EnrichGameLogsPipeline) and processes it with the advertising data (RefMarketingCampaignnTable) to create the final output of marketing campaign effectiveness, which is copied to the Azure SQL database (MarketingCampainEffectivensessSQLTable) and an Azure blob storage (MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable) for analytics.
trans-unit.target: The **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline** pipeline leverages the enriched data (EnrichedGameEventTable produced by the EnrichGameLogsPipeline) and processes it with the advertising data (RefMarketingCampaignnTable) to create the final output of marketing campaign effectiveness, which is copied to the Azure SQL database (MarketingCampainEffectivensessSQLTable) and an Azure blob storage (MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable) for analytics.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough: Creating, deploying, and monitoring workflows
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough: Creating, deploying, and monitoring workflows

trans-unit.source: [Step 1: Upload sample data and scripts](#MainStep1).
trans-unit.target: [Step 1: Upload sample data and scripts](#MainStep1).

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will upload all the sample data (including all the logs and reference data) and Hive/Pig scripts that will be executed by the workflows.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will upload all the sample data (including all the logs and reference data) and Hive/Pig scripts that will be executed by the workflows.

trans-unit.source: The scripts you execute also create an Azure SQL database (named MarketingCampaigns), tables, user-defined types, and stored procedures.
trans-unit.target: The scripts you execute also create an Azure SQL database (named MarketingCampaigns), tables, user-defined types, and stored procedures.

trans-unit.source: [Step 2: Create an Azure data factory](#MainStep2).
trans-unit.target: [Step 2: Create an Azure data factory](#MainStep2).

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create an Azure data factory named LogProcessingFactory.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create an Azure data factory named LogProcessingFactory.

trans-unit.source: [Step 3: Create linked services](#MainStep3).
trans-unit.target: [Step 3: Create linked services](#MainStep3).

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create the following linked services:
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create the following linked services:

trans-unit.source: **StorageLinkedService**.
trans-unit.target: **StorageLinkedService**.

trans-unit.source: Links the Azure storage location that contains raw game events, partitioned game events, enriched game events, marketing campaign effective information, reference geo-code data, and reference marketing campaign data to the LogProcessingFactory
trans-unit.target: Links the Azure storage location that contains raw game events, partitioned game events, enriched game events, marketing campaign effective information, reference geo-code data, and reference marketing campaign data to the LogProcessingFactory

trans-unit.source: **AzureSqlLinkedService**.
trans-unit.target: **AzureSqlLinkedService**.

trans-unit.source: Links an Azure SQL database that contains marketing campaign effectiveness information.
trans-unit.target: Links an Azure SQL database that contains marketing campaign effectiveness information.

trans-unit.source: **HDInsightStorageLinkedService**.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsightStorageLinkedService**.

trans-unit.source: Links an Azure blob storage that is associated with the HDInsight cluster that the HDInsightLinkedService refers to.
trans-unit.target: Links an Azure blob storage that is associated with the HDInsight cluster that the HDInsightLinkedService refers to.

trans-unit.source: **HDInsightLinkedService**.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsightLinkedService**.

trans-unit.source: Links an Azure HDInsight cluster to the LogProcessingFactory.
trans-unit.target: Links an Azure HDInsight cluster to the LogProcessingFactory.

trans-unit.source: This cluster is used to perform pig/hive processing on the data.
trans-unit.target: This cluster is used to perform pig/hive processing on the data.

trans-unit.source: [Step 4: Create tables](#MainStep4).
trans-unit.target: [Step 4: Create tables](#MainStep4).

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create the following tables:
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create the following tables:

trans-unit.source: **RawGameEventsTable**.
trans-unit.target: **RawGameEventsTable**.

trans-unit.source: This table specifies the location of the raw game event data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/logs/rawgameevents/) .
trans-unit.target: This table specifies the location of the raw game event data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/logs/rawgameevents/) .

trans-unit.source: **PartitionedGameEventsTable**.
trans-unit.target: **PartitionedGameEventsTable**.

trans-unit.source: This table specifies the location of the partitioned game event data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/logs/partitionedgameevents/) .
trans-unit.target: This table specifies the location of the partitioned game event data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/logs/partitionedgameevents/) .

trans-unit.source: **RefGeoCodeDictionaryTable**.
trans-unit.target: **RefGeoCodeDictionaryTable**.

trans-unit.source: This table specifies the location of the refernce geo-code data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/refdata/refgeocodedictionary/).
trans-unit.target: This table specifies the location of the refernce geo-code data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/refdata/refgeocodedictionary/).

trans-unit.source: **RefMarketingCampaignTable**.
trans-unit.target: **RefMarketingCampaignTable**.

trans-unit.source: This table specifies the location of the refernce marketing campaign data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/refdata/refmarketingcampaign/).
trans-unit.target: This table specifies the location of the refernce marketing campaign data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/refdata/refmarketingcampaign/).

trans-unit.source: **EnrichedGameEventsTable**.
trans-unit.target: **EnrichedGameEventsTable**.

trans-unit.source: This table specifies the location of the enriched game event data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/logs/enrichedgameevents/).
trans-unit.target: This table specifies the location of the enriched game event data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/logs/enrichedgameevents/).

trans-unit.source: **MarketingCampaignEffectivenessSQLTable**.This table specifies the SQL table (MarketingCampaignEffectiveness) in the Azure SQL Database defined by AzureSqlLinkedService that contains the marketing campaign effectiveness data.
trans-unit.target: **MarketingCampaignEffectivenessSQLTable**.This table specifies the SQL table (MarketingCampaignEffectiveness) in the Azure SQL Database defined by AzureSqlLinkedService that contains the marketing campaign effectiveness data.

trans-unit.source: **MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable**.
trans-unit.target: **MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable**.

trans-unit.source: This table specifies the location of the marketing campaign effectiveness data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/marketingcampaigneffectiveness/).
trans-unit.target: This table specifies the location of the marketing campaign effectiveness data within the Azure blob storage defined by StorageLinkedService (adfwalkthrough/marketingcampaigneffectiveness/).

trans-unit.source: [Step 5: Create and schedule pipelines](#MainStep5).
trans-unit.target: [Step 5: Create and schedule pipelines](#MainStep5).

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create the following pipelines:
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create the following pipelines:

trans-unit.source: **PartitionGameLogsPipeline**.
trans-unit.target: **PartitionGameLogsPipeline**.

trans-unit.source: This pipeline reads the raw game events from a blob storage (RawGameEventsTable) and creates partitions based on year, month, and day (PartitionedGameEventsTable).
trans-unit.target: This pipeline reads the raw game events from a blob storage (RawGameEventsTable) and creates partitions based on year, month, and day (PartitionedGameEventsTable).

trans-unit.source: [Step 6: Monitor pipelines and data slices](#MainStep6).
trans-unit.target: [Step 6: Monitor pipelines and data slices](#MainStep6).

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will monitor the pipelines, tables, and data slices by using the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will monitor the pipelines, tables, and data slices by using the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Upload sample data and scripts
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Upload sample data and scripts

trans-unit.source: In this step, you upload all the sample data (including all the logs and reference data) and Hive/Pig scripts that are invoked by the workflows.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you upload all the sample data (including all the logs and reference data) and Hive/Pig scripts that are invoked by the workflows.

trans-unit.source: The scripts you execute also create an Azure SQL database called **MarketingCampaigns**, tables, user-defined types, and stored procedures.
trans-unit.target: The scripts you execute also create an Azure SQL database called **MarketingCampaigns**, tables, user-defined types, and stored procedures.

trans-unit.source: The tables, user-defined types and stored procedures are used when moving the Marketing Campaign Effectiveness results from Azure blob storage to the Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: The tables, user-defined types and stored procedures are used when moving the Marketing Campaign Effectiveness results from Azure blob storage to the Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Open **uploadSampleDataAndScripts.ps1** from **C:\ADFWalkthrough** folder (or the folder that contains the extracted files) in your favorite editor, replace the highlighted with your cluster information, and save the file.
trans-unit.target: Open **uploadSampleDataAndScripts.ps1** from **C:\ADFWalkthrough** folder (or the folder that contains the extracted files) in your favorite editor, replace the highlighted with your cluster information, and save the file.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that your local machine is allowed to access the Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that your local machine is allowed to access the Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: To enable access, use the **Azure Management Portal** or **sp_set_firewall_rule** on the master database to create a firewall rule for the IP address of your machine.
trans-unit.target: To enable access, use the **Azure Management Portal** or **sp_set_firewall_rule** on the master database to create a firewall rule for the IP address of your machine.

trans-unit.source: It may take up to five minutes for this change to take effect.
trans-unit.target: It may take up to five minutes for this change to take effect.

trans-unit.source: See [Setting firewall rules for Azure SQL][azure-sql-firewall].
trans-unit.target: See [Setting firewall rules for Azure SQL][azure-sql-firewall].

trans-unit.source: In Azure PowerShell, navigate to the location where you have extracted the samples (for example: **C:\ADFWalkthrough**)
trans-unit.target: In Azure PowerShell, navigate to the location where you have extracted the samples (for example: **C:\ADFWalkthrough**)

trans-unit.source: Run **uploadSampleDataAndScripts.ps1**
trans-unit.target: Run **uploadSampleDataAndScripts.ps1**

trans-unit.source: Once the script executes successfully, you will see the following:
trans-unit.target: Once the script executes successfully, you will see the following:

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create an Azure data factory
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create an Azure data factory

trans-unit.source: In this step, you create an Azure data factory named **LogProcessingFactory**.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you create an Azure data factory named **LogProcessingFactory**.

trans-unit.source: After logging into the [Azure Preview Portal][azure-preview-portal], click **NEW** from the bottom-left corner, click **Data analytics** in the **Create** blade, and click **Data Factory** on the **Data analytics** blade.
trans-unit.target: After logging into the [Azure Preview Portal][azure-preview-portal], click **NEW** from the bottom-left corner, click **Data analytics** in the **Create** blade, and click **Data Factory** on the **Data analytics** blade.

trans-unit.source: New->DataFactory
trans-unit.target: New->DataFactory

trans-unit.source: In the **New data factory** blade, enter **LogProcessingFactory** for the **Name**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New data factory** blade, enter **LogProcessingFactory** for the **Name**.

trans-unit.source: Data Factory Blade
trans-unit.target: Data Factory Blade

trans-unit.source: If you haven’t created an Azure resource group named **ADF** already, do the following:
trans-unit.target: If you haven’t created an Azure resource group named **ADF** already, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **RESOURCE GROUP NAME**, and click **Create a new resource group**.
trans-unit.target: Click **RESOURCE GROUP NAME**, and click **Create a new resource group**.

trans-unit.source: Resource Group Blade
trans-unit.target: Resource Group Blade

trans-unit.source: In the **Create resource group** blade, enter **ADF** for the name of the resource group, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Create resource group** blade, enter **ADF** for the name of the resource group, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Create Resource Group
trans-unit.target: Create Resource Group

trans-unit.source: Select **ADF** for the **RESOURCE GROUP NAME**.
trans-unit.target: Select **ADF** for the **RESOURCE GROUP NAME**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New data factory** blade, notice that **Add to Startboard** is selected by default.
trans-unit.target: In the **New data factory** blade, notice that **Add to Startboard** is selected by default.

trans-unit.source: This add a link to data factory on the startboard (what you see when you login to Azure Preview Portal).
trans-unit.target: This add a link to data factory on the startboard (what you see when you login to Azure Preview Portal).

trans-unit.source: Create Data Factory Blade
trans-unit.target: Create Data Factory Blade

trans-unit.source: In the **New data factory** blade, click **Create** to create the data factory.
trans-unit.target: In the **New data factory** blade, click **Create** to create the data factory.

trans-unit.source: After the data factory is created, you should see the **DATA FACTORY** blade titled **LogProcessingFactory**.
trans-unit.target: After the data factory is created, you should see the **DATA FACTORY** blade titled **LogProcessingFactory**.

trans-unit.source: Data Factory Homepage
trans-unit.target: Data Factory Homepage

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Create linked services
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create linked services

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article uses the Azure Portal, specifically the Data Factory Editor, to create linked services, tables, and pipelines.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article uses the Azure Portal, specifically the Data Factory Editor, to create linked services, tables, and pipelines.

trans-unit.source: See [Tutorial using Azure PowerShell][adftutorial-using-powershell] if you want to perform this tutorial using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: See [Tutorial using Azure PowerShell][adftutorial-using-powershell] if you want to perform this tutorial using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create the following linked services:
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create the following linked services:

trans-unit.source: StorageLinkedService
trans-unit.target: StorageLinkedService

trans-unit.source: AzureSqlLinkedService
trans-unit.target: AzureSqlLinkedService

trans-unit.source: HDInsightStorageLinkedService
trans-unit.target: HDInsightStorageLinkedService

trans-unit.source: HDInsightLinkedService.
trans-unit.target: HDInsightLinkedService.

trans-unit.source: Create StorageLinkedService and HDInsightStorageLinkedService
trans-unit.target: Create StorageLinkedService and HDInsightStorageLinkedService

trans-unit.source: In the **DATA FACTORY** blade, click **Author and deploy** tile to launch the **Editor** for the data factory.
trans-unit.target: In the **DATA FACTORY** blade, click **Author and deploy** tile to launch the **Editor** for the data factory.

trans-unit.source: Author and Deploy Tile
trans-unit.target: Author and Deploy Tile

trans-unit.source: See [Data Factory Editor][data-factory-editor] topic for detailed overview of the Data Factory editor.
trans-unit.target: See [Data Factory Editor][data-factory-editor] topic for detailed overview of the Data Factory editor.

trans-unit.source: In the **Editor**, click **New data store** button on the toolbar and select **Azure storage** from the drop down menu.
trans-unit.target: In the **Editor**, click **New data store** button on the toolbar and select **Azure storage** from the drop down menu.

trans-unit.source: You should see the JSON template for creating an Azure storage linked service in the right pane.
trans-unit.target: You should see the JSON template for creating an Azure storage linked service in the right pane.

trans-unit.source: Editor New data store button
trans-unit.target: Editor New data store button

trans-unit.source: Replace **accountname** and **accountkey** with the account name and account key values for your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Replace **accountname** and **accountkey** with the account name and account key values for your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Editor Blob Storage JSON
trans-unit.target: Editor Blob Storage JSON

trans-unit.source: See [JSON Scripting Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=516971) for details about JSON properties.
trans-unit.target: See [JSON Scripting Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=516971) for details about JSON properties.

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to deploy the StorageLinkedService.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to deploy the StorageLinkedService.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you see the message **LINKED SERVICE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY** on the title bar.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you see the message **LINKED SERVICE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY** on the title bar.

trans-unit.source: Editor Blob Storage Deploy
trans-unit.target: Editor Blob Storage Deploy

trans-unit.source: Repeat the steps to create another Azure Storage linked service named: **HDInsightStorageLinkedService** for the storage associated with your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the steps to create another Azure Storage linked service named: **HDInsightStorageLinkedService** for the storage associated with your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the JSON script for the linked service, change the value of the **name** property to **HDInsightStorageLinkedService**.
trans-unit.target: In the JSON script for the linked service, change the value of the **name** property to **HDInsightStorageLinkedService**.

trans-unit.source: Create AzureSqlLinkedService
trans-unit.target: Create AzureSqlLinkedService

trans-unit.source: In the **Data Factory Editor** , click **New data store** button on the toolbar and select **Azure SQL database** from the drop down menu.
trans-unit.target: In the **Data Factory Editor** , click **New data store** button on the toolbar and select **Azure SQL database** from the drop down menu.

trans-unit.source: You should see the JSON template for creating the Azure SQL linked service in the right pane.
trans-unit.target: You should see the JSON template for creating the Azure SQL linked service in the right pane.

trans-unit.source: Replace **servername**, **username@servername**, and **password** with names of your Azure SQL server, user account, and password.
trans-unit.target: Replace **servername**, **username@servername**, and **password** with names of your Azure SQL server, user account, and password.

trans-unit.source: Replace **databasename** with **MarketingCampaigns**.
trans-unit.target: Replace **databasename** with **MarketingCampaigns**.

trans-unit.source: This is the Azure SQL database created by the scripts you ran in Step 1.
trans-unit.target: This is the Azure SQL database created by the scripts you ran in Step 1.

trans-unit.source: You should confirm that this database was indeed created by the scripts (in case there were errors).
trans-unit.target: You should confirm that this database was indeed created by the scripts (in case there were errors).

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to create and deploy the AzureSqlLinkedService.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to create and deploy the AzureSqlLinkedService.

trans-unit.source: Create HDInsightLinkedService
trans-unit.target: Create HDInsightLinkedService

trans-unit.source: The Azure Data Factory service supports creation of an on-demand cluster and use it to process input to produce output data.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Data Factory service supports creation of an on-demand cluster and use it to process input to produce output data.

trans-unit.source: You can also use your own cluster to perform the same.
trans-unit.target: You can also use your own cluster to perform the same.

trans-unit.source: When you use on-demand HDInsight cluster, a cluster gets created for each slice.
trans-unit.target: When you use on-demand HDInsight cluster, a cluster gets created for each slice.

trans-unit.source: Whereas, when you use your own HDInsight cluster, the cluster is ready to process the slice immediately.
trans-unit.target: Whereas, when you use your own HDInsight cluster, the cluster is ready to process the slice immediately.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, when you use on-demand cluster, you may not see the output data as quickly as when you use your own cluster.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, when you use on-demand cluster, you may not see the output data as quickly as when you use your own cluster.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of the sample, let's use an on-demand cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of the sample, let's use an on-demand cluster.

trans-unit.source: To use an on-demand HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: To use an on-demand HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Click **New compute** from the command bar and select **On-demand HDInsight cluster** from the menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **New compute** from the command bar and select **On-demand HDInsight cluster** from the menu.

trans-unit.source: Do the following in the JSON script:
trans-unit.target: Do the following in the JSON script:

trans-unit.source: For the **clusterSize** property, specify the size of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the **clusterSize** property, specify the size of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For the **jobsContainer** property, specify the name of the default container where the cluster logs will be stored.
trans-unit.target: For the **jobsContainer** property, specify the name of the default container where the cluster logs will be stored.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of this tutorial, specify **adfjobscontainer**.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of this tutorial, specify **adfjobscontainer**.

trans-unit.source: For the **timeToLive** property, specify how long the customer can be idle before it is deleted.
trans-unit.target: For the **timeToLive** property, specify how long the customer can be idle before it is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For the **version** property, specify the HDInsight version you want to use.
trans-unit.target: For the **version** property, specify the HDInsight version you want to use.

trans-unit.source: If you exclude this property, the latest version is used.
trans-unit.target: If you exclude this property, the latest version is used.

trans-unit.source: For the **linkedServiceName**, specify **HDInsightStorageLinkedService** that you had created in the Get started tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For the **linkedServiceName**, specify **HDInsightStorageLinkedService** that you had created in the Get started tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Note that the **type** of linked service is set to **HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService**.
trans-unit.target: Note that the **type** of linked service is set to **HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the command bar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the command bar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use your own HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: To use your own HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: Click **New compute** from the command bar and select **HDInsight cluster** from the menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **New compute** from the command bar and select **HDInsight cluster** from the menu.

trans-unit.source: Do the following in the JSON script:
trans-unit.target: Do the following in the JSON script:

trans-unit.source: For the **clusterUri** property, enter the URL for your HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: For the **clusterUri** property, enter the URL for your HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For example: https://
trans-unit.target: For example: https://

trans-unit.source: .azurehdinsight.net/
trans-unit.target: .azurehdinsight.net/

trans-unit.source: For the **UserName** property, enter the user name who has access to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the **UserName** property, enter the user name who has access to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For the **Password** property, enter the password for the user.
trans-unit.target: For the **Password** property, enter the password for the user.

trans-unit.source: For the **LinkedServiceName** property, enter **StorageLinkedService**.
trans-unit.target: For the **LinkedServiceName** property, enter **StorageLinkedService**.

trans-unit.source: This is the linked service you had created in the Get started tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This is the linked service you had created in the Get started tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Nore that the **type** of linked service is set to **HDInsightBYOCLinkedService** (BYOC stands for Bring Your Own Cluster).
trans-unit.target: Nore that the **type** of linked service is set to **HDInsightBYOCLinkedService** (BYOC stands for Bring Your Own Cluster).

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the command bar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the command bar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Create tables
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Create tables

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create the following Data Factory tables:
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create the following Data Factory tables:

trans-unit.source: RawGameEventsTable
trans-unit.target: RawGameEventsTable

trans-unit.source: PartitionedGameEventsTable
trans-unit.target: PartitionedGameEventsTable

trans-unit.source: RefGeoCodeDictionaryTable
trans-unit.target: RefGeoCodeDictionaryTable

trans-unit.source: RefMarketingCampaignTable
trans-unit.target: RefMarketingCampaignTable

trans-unit.source: EnrichedGameEventsTable
trans-unit.target: EnrichedGameEventsTable

trans-unit.source: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessSQLTable
trans-unit.target: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessSQLTable

trans-unit.source: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable
trans-unit.target: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable

trans-unit.source: Tutorial End-to-End Flow
trans-unit.target: Tutorial End-to-End Flow

trans-unit.source: The picture above displays pipelines in the middle row and tables in the top and bottom rows.
trans-unit.target: The picture above displays pipelines in the middle row and tables in the top and bottom rows.

trans-unit.source: To create the tables
trans-unit.target: To create the tables

trans-unit.source: In the **Editor** for the Data Factory, click **New dataset** button on the toolbar and click **Azure Blob storage** from the drop down menu.
trans-unit.target: In the **Editor** for the Data Factory, click **New dataset** button on the toolbar and click **Azure Blob storage** from the drop down menu.

trans-unit.source: Replace JSON in the right pane with the JSON script from the **RawGameEventsTable.json** file from the **C:\ADFWalkthrough\Tables** folder.
trans-unit.target: Replace JSON in the right pane with the JSON script from the **RawGameEventsTable.json** file from the **C:\ADFWalkthrough\Tables** folder.

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to create and deploy the table.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to create and deploy the table.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you see the **TABLE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY** message on the title bar of the Editor.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you see the **TABLE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY** message on the title bar of the Editor.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 1-3 with the content from the following files:
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 1-3 with the content from the following files:

trans-unit.source: PartitionedGameEventsTable.json
trans-unit.target: PartitionedGameEventsTable.json

trans-unit.source: RefGeoCodeDictionaryTable.json
trans-unit.target: RefGeoCodeDictionaryTable.json

trans-unit.source: RefMarketingCampaignTable.json
trans-unit.target: RefMarketingCampaignTable.json

trans-unit.source: EnrichedGameEventsTable.json
trans-unit.target: EnrichedGameEventsTable.json

trans-unit.source: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable.json
trans-unit.target: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable.json

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 1-3 with the content from the following file.
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 1-3 with the content from the following file.

trans-unit.source: BUT select **Azure Sql** after you click **New dataset**.
trans-unit.target: BUT select **Azure Sql** after you click **New dataset**.

trans-unit.source: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessSQLTable.json
trans-unit.target: MarketingCampaignEffectivenessSQLTable.json

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Create and schedule pipelines
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Create and schedule pipelines

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create the following pipelines:
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create the following pipelines:

trans-unit.source: PartitionGameLogsPipeline
trans-unit.target: PartitionGameLogsPipeline

trans-unit.source: EnrichGameLogsPipeline
trans-unit.target: EnrichGameLogsPipeline

trans-unit.source: AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline
trans-unit.target: AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline

trans-unit.source: To create pipelines
trans-unit.target: To create pipelines

trans-unit.source: In the **Data Factory Editor**, click **New pipeline** button on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: In the **Data Factory Editor**, click **New pipeline** button on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Click **... (Ellipsis)** on the toolbar if you do not see the button.
trans-unit.target: Click **... (Ellipsis)** on the toolbar if you do not see the button.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can right-click **Pipelines** in the tree view and click **New pipeline**.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can right-click **Pipelines** in the tree view and click **New pipeline**.

trans-unit.source: Replace JSON in the right pane with the JSON script from the **PartitionGameLogsPipeline.json** file from the **C:\ADFWalkthrough\Pipelines** folder.
trans-unit.target: Replace JSON in the right pane with the JSON script from the **PartitionGameLogsPipeline.json** file from the **C:\ADFWalkthrough\Pipelines** folder.

trans-unit.source: Add a **comma (',')** at the end of **closing square bracket (']')** in the JSON and then add the following three lines after the closing square bracket.
trans-unit.target: Add a **comma (',')** at the end of **closing square bracket (']')** in the JSON and then add the following three lines after the closing square bracket.

trans-unit.source: Note that the start and end times are set to 05/01/2014 and 05/05/2014 because the sample data in this walkthrough is from 05/01/2014 to 05/05/2014.
trans-unit.target: Note that the start and end times are set to 05/01/2014 and 05/05/2014 because the sample data in this walkthrough is from 05/01/2014 to 05/05/2014.

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to create and deploy the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to create and deploy the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you see the **PIPELINE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY** message on the title bar of the Editor.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you see the **PIPELINE CREATED SUCCESSFULLY** message on the title bar of the Editor.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 1-3 with the content from the following files:
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 1-3 with the content from the following files:

trans-unit.source: EnrichGameLogsPipeline.json
trans-unit.target: EnrichGameLogsPipeline.json

trans-unit.source: AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline.json
trans-unit.target: AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline.json

trans-unit.source: Close the Data Factory blades by pressing **X** (top-right corner) to see the home page (**DATA FACTORY **blade) for your Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Close the Data Factory blades by pressing **X** (top-right corner) to see the home page (**DATA FACTORY **blade) for your Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: Diagram view
trans-unit.target: Diagram view

trans-unit.source: In the **DATA FACTORY** blade for the **LogProcessingFactory**, click **Diagram**.
trans-unit.target: In the **DATA FACTORY** blade for the **LogProcessingFactory**, click **Diagram**.

trans-unit.source: Diagram Link
trans-unit.target: Diagram Link

trans-unit.source: You can rearrange the diagram you see and here is a rearranged diagram that shows direct inputs at the top and outputs at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: You can rearrange the diagram you see and here is a rearranged diagram that shows direct inputs at the top and outputs at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: You can see that the output of the **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** is passed in as an input to the EnrichGameLogsPipeline and output of the **EnrichGameLogsPipeline** is passed to the **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline**.
trans-unit.target: You can see that the output of the **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** is passed in as an input to the EnrichGameLogsPipeline and output of the **EnrichGameLogsPipeline** is passed to the **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click on a title to see details about the artifact that the blade represents.
trans-unit.target: Double-click on a title to see details about the artifact that the blade represents.

trans-unit.source: Diagram View
trans-unit.target: Diagram View

trans-unit.source: Right-click **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline**, and click **Open Pipeline**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **AnalyzeMarketingCampaignPipeline**, and click **Open Pipeline**.

trans-unit.source: You should see all the activities in the pipeline along with input and output datasets for the activities.
trans-unit.target: You should see all the activities in the pipeline along with input and output datasets for the activities.

trans-unit.source: Open pipeline
trans-unit.target: Open pipeline

trans-unit.source: Click **Data factory** in the breadcrumb in the top-left corner to get back to the diagram view with all the pipelines.
trans-unit.target: Click **Data factory** in the breadcrumb in the top-left corner to get back to the diagram view with all the pipelines.

trans-unit.source: **Congratulations!** You have successfully created the Azure Data Factory, Linked Services, Pipelines, Tables and started the workflow.
trans-unit.target: **Congratulations!** You have successfully created the Azure Data Factory, Linked Services, Pipelines, Tables and started the workflow.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Monitor pipelines and data slices
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Monitor pipelines and data slices

trans-unit.source: If you do not have the **DATA FACTORY** blade for the **LogProcessingFactory** open, you can do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: If you do not have the **DATA FACTORY** blade for the **LogProcessingFactory** open, you can do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Click **LogProcessingFactory** on the **Startboard**.
trans-unit.target: Click **LogProcessingFactory** on the **Startboard**.

trans-unit.source: While creating the data factory, the **Add to Startboard** option was automatically checked.
trans-unit.target: While creating the data factory, the **Add to Startboard** option was automatically checked.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring Startboard
trans-unit.target: Monitoring Startboard

trans-unit.source: Click **BROWSE** hub, and click **Everything**.
trans-unit.target: Click **BROWSE** hub, and click **Everything**.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring Hub Everything
trans-unit.target: Monitoring Hub Everything

trans-unit.source: In the **Browse** blade, select **Data factories** and select **LogProcessingFactory** in the **Data factories** blade.
trans-unit.target: In the **Browse** blade, select **Data factories** and select **LogProcessingFactory** in the **Data factories** blade.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring Browse Datafactories
trans-unit.target: Monitoring Browse Datafactories

trans-unit.source: You can monitor your data factory in several ways.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor your data factory in several ways.

trans-unit.source: You can start with pipelines or data sets.
trans-unit.target: You can start with pipelines or data sets.

trans-unit.source: Let’s start with Pipelines and drill further.
trans-unit.target: Let’s start with Pipelines and drill further.

trans-unit.source: Click **Pipelines** on the **DATA FACTORY** blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **Pipelines** on the **DATA FACTORY** blade.

trans-unit.source: Click **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** in the Pipelines blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **PartitionGameLogsPipeline** in the Pipelines blade.

trans-unit.source: In the **PIPELINE** blade for **PartitionGameLogsPipeline**, you see that the pipeline consumes **RawGameEventsTable** dataset.
trans-unit.target: In the **PIPELINE** blade for **PartitionGameLogsPipeline**, you see that the pipeline consumes **RawGameEventsTable** dataset.

trans-unit.source: Click **RawGameEventsTable**.
trans-unit.target: Click **RawGameEventsTable**.

trans-unit.source: Pipeline Consumed and Produced
trans-unit.target: Pipeline Consumed and Produced

trans-unit.source: In the TABLE blade for **RawGameEventsTable**, you see all the slices.
trans-unit.target: In the TABLE blade for **RawGameEventsTable**, you see all the slices.

trans-unit.source: In the following screen shot, all the slices are in **Ready** state and there are no problem slices.
trans-unit.target: In the following screen shot, all the slices are in **Ready** state and there are no problem slices.

trans-unit.source: It means that the data is ready to be processed.
trans-unit.target: It means that the data is ready to be processed.

trans-unit.source: RawGameEventsTable TABLE blade
trans-unit.target: RawGameEventsTable TABLE blade

trans-unit.source: Both **Recently updated slices** and **Recently failed slices** lists are sorted by the **LAST UPDATE TIME**.
trans-unit.target: Both **Recently updated slices** and **Recently failed slices** lists are sorted by the **LAST UPDATE TIME**.

trans-unit.source: The update time of a slice is changed in the following situations.
trans-unit.target: The update time of a slice is changed in the following situations.

trans-unit.source: You update the status of the slice manually, for example, by using the **Set-AzureDataFactorySliceStatus** (or) by clicking **RUN** on the **SLICE** blade for the slice.
trans-unit.target: You update the status of the slice manually, for example, by using the **Set-AzureDataFactorySliceStatus** (or) by clicking **RUN** on the **SLICE** blade for the slice.

trans-unit.source: The slice changes status due to an execution (e.g. a run started, a run ended and failed, a run ended and succeeded, etc).
trans-unit.target: The slice changes status due to an execution (e.g. a run started, a run ended and failed, a run ended and succeeded, etc).

trans-unit.source: Click on the title of the lists or **... (ellipses)** to see the larger list of slices.
trans-unit.target: Click on the title of the lists or **... (ellipses)** to see the larger list of slices.

trans-unit.source: Click **Filter** on the toolbar to filter the slices.
trans-unit.target: Click **Filter** on the toolbar to filter the slices.

trans-unit.source: To view the data slices sorted by the slice start/end times instead, click **Data slices (by slice time)** tile.
trans-unit.target: To view the data slices sorted by the slice start/end times instead, click **Data slices (by slice time)** tile.

trans-unit.source: Data Slices by Slice Time
trans-unit.target: Data Slices by Slice Time

trans-unit.source: Now, on the **PIPELINE** blade for **PartiionGameLogsPipeline**, click **Produced**.
trans-unit.target: Now, on the **PIPELINE** blade for **PartiionGameLogsPipeline**, click **Produced**.

trans-unit.source: You should see the list of data sets that this pipeline produces:
trans-unit.target: You should see the list of data sets that this pipeline produces:

trans-unit.source: Click **PartitionedGameEvents** table in the **Produced datasets** blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **PartitionedGameEvents** table in the **Produced datasets** blade.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the **status** of all slices is set to **Ready**.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that the **status** of all slices is set to **Ready**.

trans-unit.source: Click on one of the slices that is **Ready** to see the **DATA SLICE** blade for that slice.
trans-unit.target: Click on one of the slices that is **Ready** to see the **DATA SLICE** blade for that slice.

trans-unit.source: RawGameEventsTable DATA SLICE blade
trans-unit.target: RawGameEventsTable DATA SLICE blade

trans-unit.source: If there was an error, you would see a **Failed **status here.
trans-unit.target: If there was an error, you would see a **Failed **status here.

trans-unit.source: You might also see either both slices with status **Ready**, or both with status **PendingValidation**, depending on how quickly the slices are processed.
trans-unit.target: You might also see either both slices with status **Ready**, or both with status **PendingValidation**, depending on how quickly the slices are processed.

trans-unit.source: If the slice is not in the **Ready** state, you can see the upstream slices that are not Ready and are blocking the current slice from executing in the **Upstream slices that are not ready** list.
trans-unit.target: If the slice is not in the **Ready** state, you can see the upstream slices that are not Ready and are blocking the current slice from executing in the **Upstream slices that are not ready** list.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the [Azure Data Factory Developer Reference][developer-reference] to get an understanding of all possible slice statuses.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the [Azure Data Factory Developer Reference][developer-reference] to get an understanding of all possible slice statuses.

trans-unit.source: In the **DATA SLICE** blade, click the run from the **Activity Runs** list.
trans-unit.target: In the **DATA SLICE** blade, click the run from the **Activity Runs** list.

trans-unit.source: You should see the Activity Run blade for that slice.
trans-unit.target: You should see the Activity Run blade for that slice.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following **ACTIVITY RUN DETAILS** blade.
trans-unit.target: You should see the following **ACTIVITY RUN DETAILS** blade.

trans-unit.source: Activity Run Details blade
trans-unit.target: Activity Run Details blade

trans-unit.source: Click **Download** to download the files.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download** to download the files.

trans-unit.source: This screen is especially useful when you are troubleshooting errors from HDInsight processing.
trans-unit.target: This screen is especially useful when you are troubleshooting errors from HDInsight processing.

trans-unit.source: When all the pipeline have completed execution, you can look into the **MarketingCampaignEffectivenessTable** in the **MarketingCampaigns** Azure SQL database to view the results.
trans-unit.target: When all the pipeline have completed execution, you can look into the **MarketingCampaignEffectivenessTable** in the **MarketingCampaigns** Azure SQL database to view the results.

trans-unit.source: **Congratulations!** You can now monitor and troubleshoot the workflows.
trans-unit.target: **Congratulations!** You can now monitor and troubleshoot the workflows.

trans-unit.source: You have learned how to use Azure Data Factory to process data and get analytics.
trans-unit.target: You have learned how to use Azure Data Factory to process data and get analytics.

trans-unit.source: Extend the tutorial to use on-premises data
trans-unit.target: Extend the tutorial to use on-premises data

trans-unit.source: In the last step of log processing scenario from the walkthrough in this article, the marketing campaign effectiveness output was copied to an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: In the last step of log processing scenario from the walkthrough in this article, the marketing campaign effectiveness output was copied to an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: You could also move this data to on-premises SQL Server for analytics within your organization.
trans-unit.target: You could also move this data to on-premises SQL Server for analytics within your organization.

trans-unit.source: In order to copy the marketing campaign effectiveness data from Azure Blob to on-premises SQL Server, you need to create additional on-premises Linked Service, Table and Pipeline introduced in the walkthrough in this article.
trans-unit.target: In order to copy the marketing campaign effectiveness data from Azure Blob to on-premises SQL Server, you need to create additional on-premises Linked Service, Table and Pipeline introduced in the walkthrough in this article.

trans-unit.source: Practice the [Walkthrough: Using on-premises data source][tutorial-onpremises] to learn how to create a pipeline to copy marketing campaign effectiveness data to an on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Practice the [Walkthrough: Using on-premises data source][tutorial-onpremises] to learn how to create a pipeline to copy marketing campaign effectiveness data to an on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.target: Send Feedback

trans-unit.source: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.
trans-unit.target: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.

trans-unit.target: Please take a few minutes to submit your feedback via [email](mailto:adfdocfeedback@microsoft.com?subject=data-factory-tutorial.md).
